snippet: A study comparing DNA in almost 6,000 blood samples from India and Brazil found that subjects who got the visceral form of leishmaniasis had similar DNA variations.
abstract: Study in journal Nature Genetics comparing subjects in India and Brazil finds that those who developed lethal form of leishmaniasis, disease caused by parasites injected by sandfly bites, have similar DNA variations.
lead_paragraph: A study comparing DNA in almost 6,000 blood samples from India and Brazil found that subjects who got the visceral form of leishmaniasis had similar DNA variations.

headline.seo: A Genetic Link Found for Victims of Lethal Form of Leishmaniasis
headline.main: Leishmaniasis: A Genetic Link Found in Far-Flung Victims of a Lethal Form of a Parasitic Disease
headline.print_headline: Leishmaniasis: A Genetic Link Found in Far-Flung Victims Of a Lethal Form of a Parasitic Disease
